intro: Oxybaphus brandegeei, commonly known as the Brandegee's oxybaphus, is a rare flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, daisy-like flowers that are usually yellow or orange in color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
